name: Qalam Education Fund
mission:
Inspiring growth through nurturing education built on a sacred foundation.

We envision a community that thrives off of accessible Islamic knowledge and...
theoryOfChange: Inspiring growth through a three-pronged approach: Ta'leem (Learning), Tarbiya (Personal growth), and Suhba (Mentorship) to transform individuals into better people in line with Prophetic personality.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a score of 32/50, the organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors seeking to support global education [8]. It is verified as zakat-eligible, applying funds toward specific asnaf categories to support students and educational infrastructure [2][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to its mission with a program expense ratio of 81.2% and total revenue of $2,338,320 [1][3]. While it holds 109.7 months of working capital, the impact score of 16/50 reflects a focus on capacity building through education, where direct cost-per-beneficiary metrics are not fully established [3][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Qalam Education Fund Inc provides accessible Islamic knowledge through a sacred educational foundation designed to nurture community growth.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.2% ensuring funds reach educational initiatives
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Robust financial stability with 109.7 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing accessible Islamic education through its flagship Seminary and Alimiyyah programs [1][4]. The organization maintains a strong focus on spiritual development and community service, offering various educational resources including the Qalam Podcast [5].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization shows strong financial health and high donor alignment, though its overall score is moderated by a medium impact rating due to the nature of capacity-building work.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently has a <cite id="14">small board of only 2 members</cite>, which may limit independent oversight and diverse perspectives.
There is currently <cite id="15">no external evaluation or tracked outcome data</cite> for the 3+ years required for higher impact scoring.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets 13 of 20 standards; fails on effectiveness reporting and specific expense allocation policies.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is in a high-growth phase and has maintained a clean financial audit.
risk_factors: <cite id="20">Does not meet BBB standards for effectiveness policy or reporting</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="14">governance concentration</cite> and <cite id="20">unmet BBB standards</cite> regarding effectiveness reporting.

confidence.notes: Strong financial efficiency data but significant governance and transparency gaps.

alignment.explanation: Alignment is high due to <cite id="9">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on <cite id="18">Education Global</cite>, a high-urgency cause area for the Muslim community.
alignment.improvement: The charity could improve alignment by <cite id="19">expanding services to underserved regions</cite> with limited existing nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can verify the organization's growth through <cite id="4">official Form 990 filings</cite> and its <cite id="16">Platinum Seal from Candid</cite>. However, credibility is tempered by <cite id="14">weak board governance</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="14">expand its board of directors</cite> beyond the current two members to enhance independent oversight.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="6">100.0% program ratio</cite>, though the <cite id="12">excessive working capital of 109.7 months</cite> suggests funds could be deployed more rapidly.
impact.improvement: The organization should <cite id="17">track and report beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a cost-per-student analysis and demonstrate direct educational impact.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Developing Theory of Change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports affiliated educational and community service entities

rich_narrative.headline: Qalam Education Fund Inc provides accessible Islamic knowledge through a sacred educational foundation designed to nurture community growth.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to invest in the long-term infrastructure of Islamic scholarship and value high financial efficiency in educational grantmaking.
donor_motivations: Want to support the development of home-grown Islamic scholars
Value organizations with zero-to-low fundraising overhead
Prefer supporting established institutions with a 15+ year track record
Seek to fulfill zakat through educational empowerment
giving_considerations: Gifts support capacity building rather than immediate emergency relief
The organization holds very high cash reserves relative to annual spending
Impact is measured through institutional growth rather than individual student outcomes
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-frequency impact reporting or those who prioritize organizations with large, independent governing boards.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a documented theory of change but a lack of third-party evaluations or longitudinal student outcome data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Qalam creates impact by training community leaders and scholars who then disseminate knowledge, creating a multiplier effect in community growth.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the 'sacred foundation' of education translates into measurable community resilience and religious literacy.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite high reserves, the rapid expansion of the Seminary and Alimiyyah programs requires significant capital for faculty and facilities.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: USA, Costa Rica, Saudi Arabia, Palestine

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="6">81.2% program expense ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="21">peer median of 78.4%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Higher focus on traditional academic higher education
similar_organizations.name: Darul Qasim

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="6">81.2% program expense ratio</cite> and spends only <cite id="11">$0.01 to raise every dollar</cite>, ensuring maximum resource allocation to education.
Qalam has demonstrated significant scalability with a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 568.6%</cite>, growing from a small fund to a multi-million dollar institution.
The charity is <cite id="9">zakat-eligible</cite> and serves the <cite id="10">fuqara and masakin</cite> categories through its educational initiatives.

strengths_deep_dive: Qalam Education Fund Inc exhibits extraordinary financial stability, maintaining <cite id="12">109.7 months of working capital</cite>, which provides a massive buffer for long-term educational projects. Their grantmaking activity is also significant, with <cite id="13">$414,289 in domestic grants</cite> distributed to partners like Roots Community Inc and the Qalam Seminary to further their mission of nurturing community growth through sacred knowledge.
rich_narrative.summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc is a sacred educational foundation dedicated to providing <cite id="1">accessible Islamic knowledge</cite> through a diverse range of academic and spiritual programs. Founded in <cite id="2">2009</cite>, the organization has evolved into a significant educational institution, offering its flagship <cite id="3">Qalam Seminary and Alimiyyah Program</cite> alongside community-focused initiatives like the Qalam Podcast and various intensives. The organization reported <cite id="4">$2,338,320 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, reflecting a remarkable <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 568.6%</cite>. This growth is supported by an exceptionally efficient operational model where the organization maintains a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 81.2%</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="7">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. Beyond its domestic educational footprint, Qalam extends its reach through <cite id="8">travel and tours to regions including Palestine and Saudi Arabia</cite>, integrating traditional learning with experiential spiritual growth. As a <cite id="9">zakat-eligible entity</cite>, it serves specific asnaf categories including the <cite id="10">poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin)</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions fulfill religious obligations while fostering long-term community leadership.
